description: From Middle English niter, nitere, nitre, nytre, from Old French nitre, from Latin nitrum (“native soda, natron”), from Ancient Greek νίτρον (nítron). Ultimately from Egyptian nṯrj (“natron”). Doublet of natron. Compare also natrium, nitrogen.

entries.meaning: (US, inorganic chemistry) A mineral form of potassium nitrate (saltpetre) used in making gunpowder.
